intro: Cienfuegosia tripartita, commonly known as the three-parted cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
